DOC.brief_summary: The primary purpose protocol evaluate safety , efficacy , tolerability subcutaneous MOA-728 versus placebo subject chronic non-malignant pain Opioid-Induced Constipation ( OIC ) .
DOC.brief_title: Study Evaluating Subcutaneous MOA-728 Treatment Opioid-Induced Constipation ( OIC ) Subjects With Chronic Non-Malignant Pain
DOC.criteria: Adult outpatient opioidinduced constipation chronic nonmalignant pain . Taking oral , transdermal , intravenous , subcutaneous opioids . Willingness discontinue prestudy laxative therapy use study permit rescue laxative . Exclusion Criteria History chronic constipation initiation opioid therapy . Other GI disorder know affect bowel transit . Women pregnant , breastfeeding , plan become pregnant .
